{"step_by_step_thinking": "The firing process in ceramics involves several stages, including the low bisque stage, medium bisque stage, high bisque stage, and fusion stage. The shrinkage of the ceramic material primarily occurs during the bisque stages, where the clay is heated and hardens. Among these stages, the maximum shrinkage typically occurs in the high bisque stage, where the clay reaches its maximum hardness before the fusion stage.", "answer_choice": "A. High Bisque stage"}
